Mount Royal University Admission Requirements, Admission Categories, Program Requirements, English Language Proficiency requirements.

Mount Royal University Admission is ongoing for all interested candidates who wish to apply the admission is open to all nationals:

Mount Royal University Admission Requirements

Mount Royal University Admission Requirements is as follows:

Mount Royal University has a general policy that applies to most undergraduate programs. Each of the programs has its specific admission requirements.

To be qualified for this admission please ensure you meet the complete admission requirements demanded from the school.

Admission Categories

  • High school applicant: You are measured to be a high school applicant if you are in your last year of high school if you have left or completed high school and if you have completed fewer than eight post-secondary courses.
  • Post-secondary application
  • Mature applicant

The English Language aptitude Requirement

All applicants should meet two parts of English necessities for admission into Mount Royal if their first language (learned and understood) is not English.

  1. English Language Arts 30-1 (or equivalent) if necessary by the program, and as well,
  2. Demonstrate English Language Proficiency in one of the following ways:

English Language Proficiency                                                                     Score

 How to meet ELP  Score/Level
 1. High School/Secondary and/or Post-secondary (transferable to MRU) courses  2 years of full-time study in English (see list of English speaking countries below) and English Language Arts 30 – 1 (equivalent)
 2. LEAP 4 Advanced taken at Mount Royal  LEAP 4 with B- (80%)
 3. TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)  86 (min. 20 in each of four sections)
 4. IELTS (International English Language Test [Academic])  6.5 (min. 5.5 on each band)
 5. CAEL (Canadian Academic English Language Assessment)  70 (min. 60 in each band)
 6. MELAB (Michigan English Language Assessment Battery)  85 (min. 3 in oral component)
 7. PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English Academic)  58 (min. 55 in each area)
 8. CAE (Cambridge English: Assessment)  C1 or C2 Certificate Awarded (Pass at Grade C with min. 180 overall)
 9. CanTEST (Canadian Test of English for Scholars and Trainees)  4.5 general maximum
